title: Second commercial Lynk Global satellite still looking for launch
summary: Lynk Global said it is still waiting for Spaceflight to rebook a flight for the second commercial satellite in its cellphone-compatible broadband network, four months after the launch services provider’s space tug was kicked off a SpaceX mission.

title: NASA Highlights Climate Research on Cargo Launch, Sets Coverage
summary: NASA and SpaceX are targeting 8:44 p.m. EDT Thursday, July 14, to launch the agency’s next investigation to monitor climate change to the International Space Station.

title: Artemis 1 launch team overcomes obstacles to complete WDR test objectives
summary: NASA’s Exploration Ground Systems (EGS) program and prime launch processing contractor Jacobs completed the Wet Dress Rehearsal (WDR) countdown demonstration test for Artemis 1 at the Kennedy Space Center (KSC) on June 20. The fourth run of the test “cut off” at T-29 seconds, several seconds before the desired stop time but after demonstrating the desired objectives of the test.

title: Rocket Report: A Minotaur explodes after launch; Starship rolls to the pad
summary: "You can't predict the future, but my fingers are crossed."

title: Starlink Maritime is now available for ocean-going vessels.
summary: SpaceX announced a new Starlink product. Starlink Maritime will provide oceangoing vessels with up to 350 Mbps download while at sea. And it’s...

title: Space Force coming to grips with cybersecurity threats
summary: A key challenge for the Space Force is how to assess cyber security risks, said Lt. Gen. Stephen Whiting

title: NASA rebukes Russian use of space station for propaganda purposes [Updated]
summary: "The space station is supposed to be a symbol of peace and cooperation."

title: ESA studies options for Vega C upper stage engine ahead of first launch
summary: The European Space Agency is continuing to study options to ensure a continued supply of upper stage engines for the Vega C rocket as that vehicle gears up for its inaugural launch.

title: Dish says SpaceX’s Starlink 5G interference study is flawed
summary: Dish Network and others pushing for permission to use 12 GHz spectrum for 5G said July 7 that SpaceX’s study on how it would severely disrupt its broadband customers is “scientifically and logically flawed.”

title: Space Force effort to open doors to private sector is a slow go
summary: Companies seeking help through the Space Systems Command 'Front Door' initiative can expect to wait several days for a response
